definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
decree to grant a special pardon

pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Te4 she4 Zu3 zhi1

sentences.english: Final toleration in the edict of Nantes in 1598.
sentences.chinese: 1598年南特赦令宣佈最終信仰自由。

sentences.english: The amnesty, which was brokered by the U.
sentences.chinese: 特赦令是在美國和英國的斡旋之下達成的。

sentences.english: Maduekwe says that amnesty is boosting oil production.
sentences.chinese: 馬杜埃奎表示，特赦推動了石油生產。

sentences.english: Her spokesman said she would veto any legislation that included the amnesty.
sentences.chinese: 總統的發言人說，她將否決任何包含特赦內容的法案。

sentences.english: The proceeds will go to Amnesty International and other human rights organizations.
sentences.chinese: 拍賣所得將全數捐給國際特赦組織等人權團體。

sentences.english: Now pardoned, they left the country with Mr Clinton.
sentences.chinese: 而今，她們已被“特赦”，並跟隨克林頓回國。

sentences.english: No, I heard the King of the Saudi Arabia amnestied her.
sentences.chinese: 沒有，我聽說沙特國王特赦了她。

sentences.english: Lily: No, I heard the King of the Saudi Arabia amnestied her.
sentences.chinese: 沒有，我聽說沙特國王特赦了她。

sentences.english: Amnesty International fears that all four are at risk of torture and other ill-treatment if arrested.
sentences.chinese: 國際特赦組織擔憂這四人若被逮捕，恐遭刑求虐待。

sentences.english: Napoleon granted the great majority of émigrés amnesty in 1802.
sentences.chinese: 1802年拿破崙對大部分流亡者給予特赦。

sentences.english: We supplicate your majesty to grant him amnesty.
sentences.chinese: 我們懇求懇求陛下給予他特赦。

sentences.english: But Amnesty describes the Australia's position is a poling.
sentences.chinese: 但是國際特赦組織說澳大利亞的做法太過極端。

definition: decree to grant a special pardon
to redress (an injustice)/to rehabilitate (sb whose reputation was unjustly sullied)
to reduce penalty/shortened or commuted (judicial) sentence
to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
to release for medical treatment (of a prisoner)
